definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
lit. to drain the pond to get at the fish (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
fishing and hunting/fig. to loot/to plunder
old place name (in Yan of Warring states, in modern Beijing city)

sentences.english: The fishermen hauled the fish into the boat.
AGRICULTURE and fisheries industries are relatively small sectors in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 香港漁農業的規模相對較小。

sentences.english: Approximately 20400 people were employed directly in the industries.
sentences.chinese: 本港約有20400人直接從事漁農業。

sentences.english: For poor farmers, The award is granted to fishing than to fish.
sentences.chinese: 對於貧困農民來說，授之予魚不如授之予漁。

sentences.english: Fishermen and their dogs living on the beach share day by day this fantastic dream world.
sentences.chinese: 漁人與狗日復一日地安享着這這夢幻般的世界。

sentences.english: I came to this country knowing about the problem of pirate fishing.
sentences.chinese: 我來到塞拉利昂時，知道這裏有偷漁問題。

sentences.english: Teach students how to learn English but teach students English.
sentences.chinese: 英語教學中對後進生應“魚”“漁”並授。

sentences.english: The most famous piece of Yue style embroidery is hundreds of Birds Worshiping Phoenix.
sentences.chinese: 漁風格的刺繡最有名的作品是崇鳥鳳凰數以百計。

definition: to fish with a hook and bait
enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
to press down/to calm/to subdue/to suppress/to guard/garrison/small town/to cool or chill (food or drinks)
pavilion with a view/high/tall/high fronted, curtained carriage (old)
